result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jordan Edward Krueger

records.addlTxt:
1:29 PM Defendant Jordan Edward Krueger appeared by phone.  Prosecuting attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard are 22CF-279, 22CF-345 and 22CF-378.

Court calls cases.
Atty Cassidy states appearances.

Defendant appears without counsel today.
Defendant has reapplied with the public defender's office, has not heard back yet, contacted them about 2 weeks ago.

Matters will be adjourned one more time.
Court advises Defendant regarding counsel.

Court will not adjourn the case endlessly, gives warning.
Court advises to contact the public defender today, Court provides phone number.

Bond continues.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 31, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

1:53 PM Defendant Jordan Edward Krueger appeared by video, in custody at Green Lake Jail.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 22CF279, 22CF345, and  22CF378.
Court questions the defendant as to the status of getting a public defender.
Defendant needed to provide his past employer email to contact.
Defendant no longer works there.
JA Branch 3 will be contacting the public defender office.
BY THE COURT: Bond is continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:20 PM Defendant Jordan Edward Krueger appeared by video, in custody at Green Lake County Jail. Prosecuting attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Matter rescheduled to allow defendant get an attorney.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
**This Hearing should have been an Initial Appearance NOT and Adjourned Initial Appearance**
Adjourned initial appearance on September 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

3:06 PM Defendant Jordan Edward Krueger in court.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Cases heard today are 22CF279, 22CF345 and 22CF378.

Bond has been set.

Defendant wishes to be represented by counsel.
Defendant will continue to work with the public defender's office to obtain counsel.

BY THE COURT: 
Case is adjourned
Bond is continued on all 3 cases.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Initial Appearance set for August 22, 2022 @ 2:30 p.m. in Br 1

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

12:33 PM Defendant Jordan E Krueger appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for State of WI.  Atty Taylor Soule appears on behalf of the defendant.

ADA Dodge states facts for anticipated charges of Possession with Intent to Deliver Methamphetamine.
Co-defendant with Hailie Erickson.
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendant is eligible for public defender representation.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $2,500 signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule does not have any objections as to bond.
Court will set a $2,500 signature bond with conditions as stated on the record.
Hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
